translations.cli.short_description: CLI - Command line tool for SDK
translations.cli.long_description:
CLI is a powerful tool for managing resources in SDK.
To get started, use 'cli --help' to see all available commands.
translations.cli.help_more_info: Use "%s [command] --help" for more information about a command.
translations.cli.panic_help: Please help us improve by sending the error report to our repository:
translations.cli.i18n.list.title: Available languages
translations.cli.i18n.list.use_set: Use 'mgc i18n set <code>' to change the language.
translations.cli.i18n.set.note: To persist this configuration, you can:
translations.cli.i18n.set.note_3: 2. Use the --lang flag in each command:
translations.cli.auth.short: Actions with ID Magalu to log in, API Keys, refresh tokens, change tenants and others
translations.cli.auth.long: The authentication credentials set here will be used as a basis for a variety of HTTP requests using the MgcSDK. Authentication is done via Magalu Cloud account (Object Storage requires special keys, refer to it for more info)
translations.cli.auth.logout.long: Ends the current session by removing the token used by Magalu Cloud for authentication
translations.cli.auth.access_token.short: Retrieve the access token used in the APIs
translations.cli.auth.access_token.long: Retrieves the access token used in the APIs, validates its current status, and automatically refreshes it when needed, ensuring the returned token is always up-to-date and ready for use
translations.cli.auth.tenant.long: Tenants work like sub-accounts. You may have more than one Tenant under your Magalu Cloud account and they each store their data separately, but are billed under the same account
translations.cli.auth.tenant.current.long: The active tenant is used for all HTTP requests sent to Magalu Cloud
translations.cli.auth.tenant.list.short: List all available tenants for the current login
translations.cli.auth.tenant.list.long: Returns a list of all tenants available for the current login, including UUID, name, email, management status (isManaged), and delegation status (isDelegated)
translations.cli.auth.tenant.set.short: Set the active tenant to be used for all subsequent requests
translations.cli.auth.tenant.set.long: Sets the active tenant for all subsequent requests by providing the desired tenant's UUID
translations.cli.auth.tenant.set.observation: If you have an API Key set, changing the tenant will unset it
translations.cli.auth.tenant.select.short: Interactively list, select, and set the active tenant
translations.cli.auth.tenant.select.long: Runs an interactive flow that lists available tenants, prompts the user to select one, and then sets the chosen tenant as active
translations.cli.auth.api_key.short: Manage your ID Magalu API keys
translations.cli.auth.api_key.long:
ID Magalu API Keys are used for authentication across various platforms (CLI, SDK, Terraform, API requests). An API key has three components:

API Key: Used for Magalu API, CLI, SDK, and Terraform authentication.
Key Pair ID: Used for Object Storage authentication.
Key Pair Secret: Works with Key Pair ID for Object Storage authentication.

The API Key authenticates with the main Magalu services, while the Key Pair ID and Key Pair Secret are specifically for Object Storage. Using these components correctly allows secure interaction with Magalu services and resources.
translations.cli.auth.api_key.list.long: These API Keys belong to your account and can be used to authenticate in Magalu Cloud
translations.cli.auth.api_key.list.invalid_keys: Include Invalid Revoke and Expired Keys
translations.cli.auth.api_key.revoke.id: The ID of the API Key to revoke. To list all possible IDs, run 'auth api-key list' (required)
translations.cli.auth.api_key.revoke.short: Revoke an API key by its ID
translations.cli.auth.api_key.revoke.long: Revoke an API key by providing its unique ID. Once revoked, the key becomes invalid and can no longer be used for authentication. Use 'auth api-key list' to find valid IDs
translations.cli.auth.api_key.get.id: The ID of the desired API Key. To list all possible IDs, run 'auth api-key list' (required)
translations.cli.auth.api_key.get.short: Get a specific API Key by its ID
translations.cli.auth.api_key.get.long: Retrieve a specific API Key by providing its unique ID. Use 'auth api-key list' to see all available IDs
translations.cli.auth.api_key.create.short: Create a new API Key for your tenant
translations.cli.auth.api_key.create.long: Create a new API Key for your tenant by specifying a name, description, expiration date, and a list of scopes
translations.cli.auth.api_key.create.name: Name of new API Key
translations.cli.auth.api_key.create.scopes: List of scopes to assign to new API Key
translations.cli.auth.api_key.create.expiration: Date to expire new API Key (YYYY-MM-DD)
translations.cli.auth.clients.short: Manage clients (OAuth applications) to use with ID Magalu
translations.cli.auth.clients.long: Manage clients (OAuth applications) used for authentication and authorization with ID Magalu. This command allows you to create, update, and list clients, as well as configure redirect URLs, associated security policies, and more
translations.cli.auth.clients.create.long: Create a new client (OAuth application) for authentication and authorization with ID Magalu. This command allows you to define the necessary settings for the client to operate, including security policies, redirect URLs, access permissions, and authentication behaviors, enabling secure integration of applications with the platform.
translations.cli.auth.clients.create.always_require_l: Ignore active Magalu ID session and always require login
translations.cli.auth.clients.create.grant_types: Grant types the client can request for token generation (separated by space)
translations.cli.auth.clients.create.name: Name of the new client
translations.cli.auth.clients.create.refresh_token_cu: Use a custom expiration value for refresh tokens
translations.cli.auth.clients.create.refresh_token_ex: Custom refresh token expiration time (in seconds)
translations.cli.auth.clients.create.request_reason: Reason for creating the client. Helps with the application approval process
translations.cli.auth.clients.update.long: Updates a client (OAuth application) used for authentication and authorization with ID Magalu. This command allows you to modify client settings such as redirect URLs, security policies, access permissions, and authentication behaviors.
translations.cli.auth.clients.list.long: Lists the clients (OAuth applications) associated with the user in ID Magalu, allowing you to view the registered applications.
